bioghist.p: The Philadelphia Botanical Society was founded in 1891. The membership consists of professional botanists, interested amateurs, and collectors. In 1908 the publication of the serial Bartonia was initiated, which has continued to the present time, although appearing somewhat irregularly.

scopecontent.p: Manuscript and typed minutes of monthly meetings of the Philadelphia Botanical Club between January 1959 and December 1961. Minutes were kept primarily by Walter M. Benner, recording secretary. Minutes document the club's business, such as nominations for membership, and provide brief descriptions of programs held at the monthly meetings. Presenters included Ida K. Langman, speaking on the topic of botanical studies in Mexico. The collection also includes a list of contributions for an anniversary gift in honor of Bayard Long in 1944 and an excerpt from Bartonia about funds given by members of the club to the Academy of Natural Sciences Botany Department.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
